fields.description: At this point in time, the Crucible REST API does not allow you to update an existing review's data.  Any POST calls to {{reviews-v1/{id}}} will create a new review.

fields.description:
When a re-index is triggered (e.g. because we bumped the cache version number), the repository entries in the cross-repository Lucene index aren't being cleared.

The result is that changesets are returned by the Lucene search for the activity stream, but can't be loaded from the RevisionCache
fields.summary: Cross-repository Lucene index isn't being updated when re-indexing a repository

fields.description:
The latest version of Crowd integration JAR (2.0.7) is incompatible with Fisheye/Crucible.

In the Crowd SSO [documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWDKB/JIRA+Confluence+Trusted+Application+Not+Working+With+Crowd+SSO] it's suggested that you use the {{crowd-integration-client}} JAR that matches your Crowd installation.  Fisheye ships with {{crowd-integration-client-2.0.0.jar}}, however if you try to use the latest {{crowd-integration-client-2.0.7.jar}} file you will get the following error on startup:

{noformat}
00:20:51 ERROR - Error for /
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: com.atlassian.crowd.integration.http.HttpAuthenticatorFactory.getHttpAuthenticator()Lcom/atlassian/crowd/integration/http/HttpAuthenticator;
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.user.crowd.CrowdAuth.getHttpAuthenticator(CrowdAuth.java:126)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.user.crowd.CrowdAuth.access$000(CrowdAuth.java:45)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.user.crowd.CrowdAuth$4.call(CrowdAuth.java:249)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.user.crowd.CrowdAuth$4.call(CrowdAuth.java:247)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.user.crowd.CrowdAuth.withTimer(CrowdAuth.java:79)

{noformat}
fields.summary: crowd-integration-client-2.0.7.jar not compatible with Fisheye/Crucible

fields.description:
The branch selector dropdown currently ranks a global match the same as an exact match.

See the screenshot attached: If I type 2.4, then 2.4 should be at the top of the dropdown.

Or at least - hitting return after typing 2.4 should select the 2.4 branch, not 2.2.4
fields.summary: Branch selector matching too greedy

fields.description:
A {{NullPointerException}} occurred in {{SvnCache#getFileRevision}} when an attempt was made to load a FileRevision with a {{null}} {{RevInfoKey}}.

The result was that in some situations, the indexing of the repository was stopped.
fields.summary: NullPointerException in SvnCache.getFileRevision

fields.description:
When you look at the history of a file in an hg repo (and possibly other types -- haven't tested others) you see multiple revisions marked HEAD, all of which can be shown as committed to the default branch. This is because some of them are the HEADs of branches, but no commits have been made to that file on the branch since the branch was created.

We need to make it easy to see which branch the revision is head of -- perhaps by putting a branch name next to the HEAD icon?
fields.summary: Change history shows multiple heads in hg repo, without indicating which branches the revision is head of

fields.description:
There are some resources exposed in FeCru where depending on their existence user may get 403 or 404 http response code depending on the existence of the resource.   Because the permission check is done earlier than existence check, server may leak the existence of particular resource to the requestor, even when the requestor doesn't have permission to access that resource.
Current behaviour seems more in line with definitions of the HTTP 403 and 404 status codes (see RFC 2616), but allows information leak.
fields.summary: Wrong HTTP response codes leak information

fields.description:
We recently moved from the Crucible/Fisheye trial to licensed Crucible with the light SVN plugin.

We cannot browse our depot or create reviews against changes in our depot.

fields.summary: moved from Fisheye to SVN light and cannot browse repository

fields.description:
if you hit

/?dialog=/profile/showWatches.do

when youre not logged in, it sends you in an infinite redirect loop. i suspect this is because iframes suck, and although the login url is being requested, the iframe is sending the cached url (/?dialog=/profile/showWatches.do) and the server redirects you again.
fields.summary: infinite redirects to login via dialog iframes

fields.description:
Dev feedback from documentation blitz test:

* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Creating+a+Snippet+Review
There are a couple of user comments regarding syntax highlighting, and adding new languages. We should probably link to where we get them (I'm guessing we have that somewhere) and explain how to add your own (looking for that now)... After looking for it, all i could find were these 3 pages http://confluence.atlassian.com/dosearchsite.action?searchQuery.queryString=ancestorIds:88703981+AND+syntax+highlight&searchQuery.spaceKey=FISHEYE none of which explain what they are / how to use them.
fields.summary: Add more information about syntax highlighting in snippet reviews documentation

fields.description:
If a repo Location contains a trailing space , then this gets preserved into the config.xml and even passed to svn.

Are there any situations where we want a text field not to have its contents trimmed? If so, we will need to look further at this fix.

Another approach, though more involved, would be to trim() all values as they go into the config.xml ....
fields.summary: GWT Text fields are not trimmed

fields.description:
The Recent Activity page in the admin uses the server time to show when an activity started. This is not very useful when the servers time is out of synch. We could improve this by:

* showing the servers time somewhere
* displaying a relative time e.g. 'seconds ago'
fields.summary: Improve the timestamps being displayed on the 'Recent Activity' page in the admin

fields.description:

from https://bamboo-extranet.atlassian.com/download/CRUCHG-CHAIN-FUNC2/build_logs/CRUCHG-CHAIN-FUNC2-160.log
{code}
build	12-Oct-2010 01:10:21	     [java] 01:10:21 INFO  - Creating test: com.atlassian.crucible.functest.spi.ReviewServiceCommentsFuncTest
build	12-Oct-2010 01:10:21	     [java] 01:10:21 ERROR -

build	12-Oct-2010 01:10:21	     [java] ==> ${notification.comment.inlineComment.frx.fileRevision.fileName} [on line 16, column 25 in comment-notification.ftl]
build	12-Oct-2010 01:10:21	     [java]  in user-directive compress [on line 5, column 5 in comment-notification.ftl]
build	12-Oct-2010 01:10:21	     [java] ----------

build	12-Oct-2010 01:10:21	     [java] 	at freemarker.core.TemplateObject.assertNonNull(TemplateObject.java:124)
build	12-Oct-2010 01:10:21	     [java] 	at freemarker.core.TemplateObject.invalidTypeException(TemplateObject.java:134)

This seems to happen when a notification is sent after a review is deleted.

fields.description: The autocomplete for the Committer dropdown in the revisions and activity filters is matching any occurrence of the letter typed.  In the case of the attached screenflow, typing the letter "C" is returning all committers since they all have a "C" in the email address (".com").  At least we should return names with the actual letter first.  Here, Connor has 2 C's in his name and yet he's showing up second in the list after Anna (with no C's).
fields.summary: Autocomplete in committer dropdown malfunctioning

fields.description:
The patch appears to be anchored correctly, but crucible doesn't acutally link to the correct revision: 

!http://img.skitch.com/20101013-1dhdbapcjhw39qsx1qkdereuh8.jpg! 

Note the date of the first revision is shown, rather than the revision id. 

The patch header looks something like: 

{noformat}
diff -r 1605d49703e5 ReleaseProcedure.txt
--- a/ReleaseProcedure.txt      Sun Aug 08 15:17:49 2010 -0500
+++ b/ReleaseProcedure.txt      Wed Oct 13 11:14:34 2010 +1100
{noformat} 

The first line contains the revision id we should be anchoring against.
fields.summary: Patch anchoring does not work for "hg diff"

joe: MAJOR: wiki link rendering broken - \[link name|http://google.com\] should render a link, but gives 

!http://img.skitch.com/20101013-edqadtymh8q6tg52wdhw1rye72.png!

{noformat}

     [java] java.lang.NullPointerException: sourceName must not be null
     [java] 	at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkNotNull(Preconditions.java:197)
     [java] 	at com.cenqua.crucible.revision.source.RepositorySource.<init>(RepositorySource.java:96)
     [java] 	at com.cenqua.crucible.revision.source.DefaultSourceFactory.makeRepositorySource(DefaultSourceFactory.java:87)
     [java] 	at com.cenqua.crucible.revision.source.DefaultSourceFactory.makeSource(DefaultSourceFactory.java:83)
     [java] 	at com.cenqua.crucible.revision.source.DefaultSourceFactory.getSource(DefaultSourceFactory.java:63)
     [java] 	at com.cenqua.crucible.revision.source.DefaultSourceFactory.getSource(DefaultSourceFactory.java:44)
     [java] 	at com.cenqua.crucible.filters.CrucibleFilter$Context.getSource(CrucibleFilter.java:47)
     [java] 	at com.cenqua.crucible.filters.CrucibleFilter.getSource(CrucibleFilter.java:130)

     [java] 	at com.atlassian.renderer.v2.components.LinkRendererComponent.render(LinkRendererComponent.java:96)

{noformat}
fields.summary: Wiki links are broken

fields.description:
MichaelH: MAJOR: Adding a CVS repository using the defaults results in a 'Per-author lines of code statistics are turned off for this repository' warning on the Repository Status page. Still, the 'store-diff' is set to true in the config.xml. Also, line chart is available. So looks like the condition for the warning is wrong

AnnaB: its not actually possible to turn off store-diff for cvs, so it definitely is

MichaelH: !http://img.skitch.com/20101012-cgphjckh84pyaufrufuham7aht.jpg!

MichaelH: If it's not possible to turn of the store diff for CVS we should remove the 'store diff info' checkbox from the add repository dialog?

MichaelH: MAJOR: Store diffs checkbox is missing on the SCM Details tab, but is present when initially adding a CVS repository: 

!http://img.skitch.com/20101012-1bew31g2r4tmqkyht2y2rcqs4d.jpg!
fields.summary: CVS store-diff setting needs fixing
